page.title: 20THE VILLAGE OF SAXTON
page.content: Saxton is a village located in the undulating countryside of North Yorkshire. It is a quiet village away from the main road, hence there is little traffic passing through the village. There is no industry in the village as the surrounding countryside is mainly used for agricultural purposes. Most of the residents either work on the surrounding farms or in the nearby towns. The residents form a very close knit community. The centre of the village is marked by a church and adjoining school. The church is built from local stone and has a spire which can be seen above the roofline of the surrounding buildings. The Post Office is the only shop in the village providing basic goods and services.
